channel.title: CVE Feed for cyberlord92 -- Web Application Firewall – website security
channel.description: The latest CVEs for cyberlord92 -- Web Application Firewall – website security

item.title: CVE-2022-4539|2024-08-31T09:35:55.748Z -- cyberlord92 -- web%20application%20firewall%20%E2%80%93%20website%20security
item.description: The Web Application Firewall plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to IP Address Spoofing in versions up to, and including, 2.1.2. This is due to insufficient restrictions on where the IP Address information is being retrieved for request logging and login restrictions. Attackers can supply the X-Forwarded-For header with with a different IP Address that will be logged and can be used to bypass settings that may have blocked out an IP address or country from logging in.

item.title: CVE-2024-2172|2024-06-24T14:45:20.223Z -- cyberlord92 -- web%20application%20firewall%20%E2%80%93%20website%20security
item.description: The Malware Scanner plugin and the Web Application Firewall plugin for WordPress (both by MiniOrange) are vulnerable to privilege escalation due to a missing capability check on the mo_wpns_init() function in all versions up to, and including, 4.7.2 (for Malware Scanner) and 2.1.1 (for Web Application Firewall). This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to escalate their privileges to that of an administrator.

item.title: CVE-2024-2172|2024-03-13T15:26:53.433Z -- cyberlord92 -- web%20application%20firewall%20%E2%80%93%20website%20security
item.description: The Malware Scanner plugin and the Web Application Firewall plugin for WordPress (both by MiniOrange) are vulnerable to privilege escalation due to a missing capability check on the mo_wpns_init() function in all versions up to, and including, 4.7.2 (for Malware Scanner) and 2.1.1 (for Web Application Firewall). This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to escalate their privileges to that of an administrator.
